title: 1965 Book Display Face
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415235856im_/http:/typophile.com/files/grotesk-sample_4708.jpg)

This is from a book titled "Is Paris Burning?" and published by Simon and Schuster, Inc. in 1965.

This font is only used on the inside front and back flap as a title for the maps on both. I thought it was Akzidenz-Grotesk Bold but now I'm not so sure (it's not Helvetica either). The boxed orange letters shown with the type image are Akzidenz-Grotesk Bold from [Berthold](http://web.archive.org/).

Any thoughts appreciated.

Thanks!  
-David

Font: 

 AG Old Face Bold 

Solved By: 

 [Les ONeill](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415235856/http:/typophile.com/user/216897 "View user profile.")
author: davidyeiser

comments.content: I think this is AG Old Face Bold (same company and a related family)

Yes, that seems very close (see attached image). However, I'm confused on the timeline — Berthold's website says AG Old Face was released in 1984, but the book I have was published in 1965 (well, that's the copyright date anyways).

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415235856im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ag-old-style-medium_3604.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415235856im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ag-old-style-bold_4325.jpg)

Akzidenz-Grotesk was released by Berthold in 1896 as a metal type -- digital came in the 1980s. Also available as metal type from Linotype and Intertype. Your book is definitely pre-digital so ignore the digital release dates.  
Digital versions are not necessarily a perfect match to the metal type.  
Don

Thanks for the clarification. I'm going to go ahead and mark this as AG Old Face Bold. (Or is it Medium? I really can't decide).

Thanks again for the help!
